Module org.example.miniproyecto2
Package org.example.miniproyecto2.Model

Class Board

java.lang.Object
org.example.miniproyecto2.Model.BoardAdapter
org.example.miniproyecto2.Model.Board
All Implemented Interfaces:
IBoard
public class Board extends BoardAdapter
Represents the complete Sudoku board.

This class extends BoardAdapter and includes logic for setting up the board, validating cells and values, filling the board with random numbers, checking board completion, and providing hints.

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board(int width, int height)
      Constructs a new Board with the specified width and height.

      The board is initialized with a set of blocks, cells, and initial values.

      Parameters:
      width - the number of columns in the board
      height - the number of rows in the board

  • Method Details

    • fillBoard

      public void fillBoard()
      Fills the board with random valid values for some of the cells.

      2 random values per block are placed into the cells in a way that respects Sudoku rules. The initial cells are recorded and cannot be modified.

    • isValueValid

      public boolean isValueValid(int cellCol, int cellRow, int value)
      Validates whether a given value can be placed in the specified cell.

      This method checks the row, column, and block to ensure no conflicts with existing values.

      Specified by:
      isValueValid in interface IBoard
      Overrides:
      isValueValid in class BoardAdapter
      Parameters:
      cellCol - the column index of the cell (0-based)
      cellRow - the row index of the cell (0-based)
      value - the value to validate
      Returns:
      true if the value can be placed, false if it conflicts with existing values

    • isCellValid

      public boolean isCellValid(int cellCol, int cellRow)
      Validates whether the specified cell is valid in terms of its current value.

      This method checks the row, column, and block to ensure no conflicts with other cells.

      Specified by:
      isCellValid in interface IBoard
      Overrides:
      isCellValid in class BoardAdapter
      Parameters:
      cellCol - the column index of the cell (0-based)
      cellRow - the row index of the cell (0-based)
      Returns:
      true if the cell is valid, false otherwise

    • getHint

      public Optional<Hint> getHint()
      Provides a hint for a random empty cell with a valid value.
      Returns:
      an Optional containing a Hint if a valid value is found for an empty cell, or Optional.empty() if no valid values are found

    • updateEmptyCells

      public void updateEmptyCells()
      Updates the list of empty cells on the board. This method will clear the current list and add all cells that are empty.

    • resetBoard

      public void resetBoard()
      Resets the board to its initial state, clearing all non-fixed cells. The cells that were initially filled cannot be modified.

    • isBoardComplete

      public boolean isBoardComplete()
      Checks if the board is complete and all cells are valid.
      Returns:
      true if the board is complete and valid, false otherwise

    • testBoard

      public void testBoard()
      Tests the board by filling it with a predefined solved Sudoku grid.
